program_name: Energy Efficiency and Conservation Loan Program
what_does_program_do: The Energy Efficiency and Conservation Loan Program (EECLP) provides funds to help consumers save money, reduce the need to purchase or generate energy, reduce electricity emissions, and help strengthen rural economies through energy efficiency and conservation projects.
who_can_apply_for_program_description: EECLP loans are available to utilities that provide retail electric service to people in rural areas in the following ways:
eligible_area_description: Rural towns or unincorporated areas that have a population of 20,000 inhabitants or fewer are eligible. Eligible communities can be combined into service territories that exceed 20,000.
eligible_area_contact_gfr_instruction: We encourage you to contact your General Field Representative (GFR) to see if your program is eligible. A full list of GFRs is available at this link:
how_to_get_started_step_2_instruction: We encourage you to contact your GFR to begin the application process. A full list of GFRs is available at this link:
how_to_get_started_step_3_instruction: Contact the Rural Electric Program's Office of Loan Origination and Approval (OLOA). A list of contacts is available at this link:
how_can_funds_be_used_1: Attract new business and create jobs in rural communities by investing in energy efficiency
how_can_funds_be_used_2: Encourage the use of renewable energy fuels
how_can_funds_be_used_3: Improve energy efficiency and reduce peak demand on the customer side of the meter
how_can_funds_be_used_5: Use existing electric facilities more efficiently
examples_of_projects_include_5: Distribution generation for on- or off-grid renewable energy investments
who_can_answer_questions_1_instruction: Contact the GFR in your area. A full list of GFRs is available at this link:
who_can_answer_questions_2_instruction: Contact the Rural Electric Program's Office of Loan Origination and Approval (OLOA). A list of contacts is available at this link:
